title: Not much to see
review: Even as a free attraction, it is barely worth a visit. The mausoleum lies in ruin and it's surrounded by kids asking for money or chocolate. The most interesting part of our visit was a heard of water buffalo on the riverbank below.

title: Poorly Maintained Place
review: It is near to the Itmad-ud-daulah tomb and is a quite low affair place. Maintenance of the building is poor and people can be seen playing cards.  It is tomb of Afzal Khan who was a minister in the court of Shah Jahan. Different coloured tiles are used in the monument like blue, yellow and green.  It is open 24 hours a day and one can enter freely here. Herds of cattle can be easily seen here. This place has historical significance, but poorly maintained.

title: Disappointed
review: The place was good but it is not properly maintained by the government. It is situated centrally, near to itmad-ud-daulah. It was a perfect piece of it was maintained properly.

title: a small but a beautiful  building from mughal dynasty.
review: Agra is basically famous for taj mahal and agra fort but there are lots of small but beautiful buildings to visit. Chini ka rauza is also a   beautiful building .The tomb was builtin 1639 by mulla shukrullah shirazi who was the prime minister of shah jahan.

title: Indo Persian architecture
review: This small tomb which showcases Indo Persian architecture was built in the banks of river Yamuna in the memory of Persian poet Afzal Khan Aalmi. I found this tomb located in a narrow bylane on the road from Ram Bagh to ItumiudDaulah Tomb. Use of glazed tiles of different colors like yellow, green, aquamarine etc is quite eye catching. But sadly this place lies neglected and is not well maintained.

title: Beautiful Building!!!
review: Chini Ka Rauza is situated on the Banks of Yamuna River. Agra. Not properly maintained. There are small and beautiful buildings to visit.

title: Unnoticed monument but worth visiting
review: Worth visiting monument in Agra. Chini ka Rauza is a funerary monument, it has the tomb of Allama Afzal Khan Mullah, a scholar and poet who was the Prime Minister of the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan (builder of Taj Mahal) in 1635. Amazing tiles work surrounded the whole tomb. It is neighbour monument of Itimad-ud-Daulah.

title: Alas-Its ignored by the authorities.
review: Though good for students of architecture & photographers.this monument requires a big push from the ASI authorities .

title: A monument crying for more attention.
review: A lesser frequented monument in Agra, we decided to visit this place during our tour in August 2018. While planning our trip we had decided on visiting some of the lesser known monuments in Agra and this was one of them.

title: Monument of Ruined Craftmanship
review: This monument is very near to Itmad-Ud-Daulah on yamuna river bank.

title: Ruins not maintained
review: Chini ka Rauza is situated about 11 Kms from Agra Cant Railway station and just 1 kilometer north of Itmad-Ud-Daulah Tomb, on the eastern bank of Yamuna river in Agra. It is open: on all days  from Sunrise to Sunset. The approach is not prominent and tourists normally give this sight a skip.

title: Neglected heritage
review: This is one landmark mausoleum which has fallen to neglect and got crushed under the fame of massive Taj Mahal. Its possibly the only monument left which was made by a special masonary originated in Iran. Finding this place too is a bit of a work. ASI should take it under its wings to save it from getting lost for ever.
